text: Sheila Sloan Frahm (born March 22, 1945) is an American politician. She was the U.S. Senator from Kansas as a Republican for a short time in 1996. She replaced Senator Bob Dole who retired to focus on his 1996 presidential campaign. Frahm lost in the Republican primary in the special senate election to keep her senate seat to Sam Brownback. ==References== Category:1945 births Category:Living people Category:Kansas Republicans Category:United States senators from Kansas
title: Sheila Frahm
